itemLabel: Charles Stuart-Wortley, 1st Baron Stuart of Wortley

wikipedia_page.main: Charles Beilby Stuart-Wortley, 1st Baron Stuart of Wortley  (15 September 1851 – 24 April 1926), was a British Conservative politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1880 until 1916, shortly before he was raised to the peerage. He served as Under-Secretary of State for the Home Department between 1885–1886 and 1886–1892 in the Conservative administrations headed by Lord Salisbury.
